p: At the end of the test in June, the mint plants exposed to metals showed phytotoxic effects translated by leaf fall and chlorosis. The stems showed an elongation of 46 ± 7 cm and rare leaves compared to the control plants with a growth of 54 ± 5 cm and an abundance of leaves. It was observed a reduction in the roots size for AsCd and AsCdNiPb tests compared to the control.
